titleInfo.title: Audio - Memphis on NPR's Weekend Edition

mods.abstract: Numerous topics related to Memphis are discussed during an episode of Weekend Edition, an NPR program. Starts with a journalist's persepctive on the state of the city. A story about the election of Willie Herenton includes the voices of community members calling in to local radio shows. Hampton Sides covers the new Pyramid. A reporter visits A. Schwab's store on Beale and speaks with proprietor Abe Schwab. A visit to Lucius Burch's Wolf River Society for the Prevention of Taking Oneself Too Seriously. A visit to Graceland. The brothers of the Eric Gales Band -- Manuel Gales (aka "Little Jimmy King"), Eric Gales and Eugene Gales -- record at Ardent Studios. Recorded off of WKNO, there are a few breaks in the original recording.

subject.topic: Wolf River Society for the Prevention of Taking Oneself Too Seriously

relatedItem.abstract: A collection of all things Memphis... a little bit of this, a little bit of that. The M Files is a great place to find portraits and newspaper clippings, but also so much more. As the clippings from the Memphis Information File are digitized, they will be added to The M Files, but so will the smaller manuscript collections and most of the items used to create the topical digital displays in the Memphis Room.
